result.execSummary:
The defendant Tawan Mantree Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution is set at $0.00.
- Obtain and maintain full-time employment, school, or combination of both.
- No Contact with Ashley J. or Demarrow M.

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete Anger Management.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tawan Mantree Stewart in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Successfully complete Anger Management.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety. 
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
          combination of both.
     *   No firearms.
     *   No contact with Ashley J. or Demarrow M.
     *   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay
          the DNA surcharge.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the
         end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a 
         civil judgment.
     *   Restitution is set at $0.00.

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights, received and filed
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tawan Mantree Stewart in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

State advised the Court they have NOT complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21. Court vacates the jury trial scheduled for 5/23/2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/04/2016
Court orders cash bail set at $50.00.  All other conditions of release previously set to remain the same.

Defendant Tawan Mantree Stewart in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case in court due to JusticePoint Program violation, positive breathalyzer.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes defendant.  Court orders signature bond converted to $50.00 cash bail.  Case remains calendared for plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 21.

Defendant Tawan Mantree Stewart in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services pretrial report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Tawan Mantree Stewart in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tawan Mantree Stewart in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.   All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:  Ashley J;  Demarrow M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tawan Mantree Stewart in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Tawan Mantree Stewart in custody.  
Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.
Defense moves to Strike Penalty Enhancer (Use of Dangerous Weapon). Arguments heard. Motion DENIED by the Court.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
